sub_title: Geospatial Data Science || Climate Risk & Adaptation || Food Systems || Ecosystem Services
summary: My research harnesses geospatial data, big data, machine/deep learning and simulation models to provide detailed and timely information for resilient food systems, watersheds and ecosystems.

projects: [{'title': 'Novel Approaches for Efficient Targeting and Equitable Scaling of Rice Technologies', 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': 'To achieve efficient targeting and equitable scaling of scalable rice technologies to increase income and food security of smallholder farmers and in particular of women and the youth.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Confidence', 'last_name': 'Duku', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Geospatial Data Science || Climate Risk & Adaptation || Food Systems || Ecosystem Services'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Paul', 'last_name': 'Kiepe', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Retired'}]}, {'title': 'Capitalizing the inland valley potential for food and nutrition security for smallholder farmers in West Africa (CIPA)', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': 'The project aims to test and promote an integrated best-bet and best-fit land-use planning, natural resource management and crop production system approach in wetlands (so-called inland valleys â€” IVs) to achieve sustainable food and nutrition security in West Africa.
